page.title: 17TRANSPORT IN CRUDEN BAY.
page.content: Most people living in Cruden Bay own their own cars,young people own motor bikes, and children(and a few adults) use bicycles. Public transport is provided by Northern Scottish buses.From Monday to Friday 12 buses come through Cruden Bay going to Peterhead ,the earliest being 06.56 and the latest 23.53 7 buses on Sunday.The bus fares are Â£2 single to Aberdeen Â£3 return 96p.single.to Peterhead. A railway used to run through Cruden Bay and there used to be station From which visitors to the old Hotel were Transported in electic tram cars.This railway was closed in the mid sixties. Helicopters fly back and forth over C/B frequently transporting workers to and from the oil rigs.A survey showed that parents commute to Aberdeen Peterhead, Ellon and Off-shore, mainly
